citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has identified some animals with possible ringworm and has been treating them with a spray Scarlex that is
labeled for horses and ponies and has not discussed treatment with the attending veterinarian. The attending veterinarian
said that this spray hasn't been approved and that a visit to see the affected animals is needed to prescribe treatment.
The use of medications without contacting the attending veterinarian might not improve the condition or have poor effects
on animals. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to visit and observe the animals with possible ringworm and
follow the AV's prescribed treatment for affected animals.
***Correct by July 1, 2024.

Fifteen enclosures in the NW corner of the building were wet and soiled by the drinking valve. This area of the building
also had more flies. Wet and soiled material can cause animal discomfort and can also create areas for flies to reproduce
in. Ensure to clean all enclosures more often to prevent wet and soiled areas.
***Correct by 6/21/2024.

The building had excessive flies in it. Flies were seen landing on bedding, animal feed, and guinea pigs. Sticky-tape was
observed to be in use but most of the tape was already covered in flies. Excessive flies can spread sicknesses and cause
animal discomfort. An effective pest control program must be in place to prevent excessive flies. To protect the health of
the guinea pigs ensure that a safe pest control program is in place to effectively reduce the number of flies in building.
***Correct by 6/28/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility has identified some animals with possible ringworm and has been treating them with a spray Scarlex that is 
labeled for horses and ponies and has not discussed treatment with the attending veterinarian. The attending veterinarian 
said that this spray hasn't been approved and that a visit to see the affected animals is needed to prescribe treatment. 
The use of medications without contacting the attending veterinarian might not improve the condition or have poor effects 
on animals. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to visit and observe the animals with possible ringworm and 
follow the AV's prescribed treatment for affected animals.  
***Correct by July 1, 2024. 
3.31(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation. 
Fifteen enclosures in the NW corner of the building were wet and soiled by the drinking valve. This area of the building 
also had more flies. Wet and soiled material can cause animal discomfort and can also create areas for flies to reproduce 
in. Ensure to clean all enclosures more often to prevent wet and soiled areas.  
***Correct by 6/21/2024. 
3.31(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The building had excessive flies in it. Flies were seen landing on bedding, animal feed, and guinea pigs. Sticky-tape was 
observed to be in use but most of the tape was already covered in flies. Excessive flies can spread sicknesses and cause 
animal discomfort. An effective pest control program must be in place to prevent excessive flies. To protect the health of 
the guinea pigs ensure that a safe pest control program is in place to effectively reduce the number of flies in building.  
***Correct by 6/28/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
